subject: Music
title: Choral Music and Its Power
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Choral Music and Its Power.

hook.text: When a hundred voices sing as one, the sound is primal ‚Äî it vibrates in your chest.

buildup.text: From Gregorian chant to gospel choirs, group singing is humanity's oldest musical tradition.

discovery.text: Mozart's Requiem and Beethoven's Ninth use choirs to achieve sounds no instrument can match.

twist.text: Singing in a choir synchronizes heartbeats ‚Äî performers literally become one organism.

climax.text: Choral music proves that the human voice multiplied becomes something superhuman.

punchline.text: One voice is personal. A hundred voices is transcendent.

quiz.question: What physical effect does singing in a choir have?
options: It synchronizes the heartbeats of the singers
